description: Entering production in 1995, the BMW Z3 was a small, two seat sports car that was a bit more conventional in design than the crazy Z1. Offered in coupe and roadster forms, the Z3 was the first BMW car to be produced outside Germany. A variety of 4 and 6 cylinder engines were offered from the sedan range and were mated to manual and automatic transmissions. The Z3 gained some quick fame when it was James Bond's car of choice in GoldenEye and a rare special edition was even offered.

GR Auto Gallery is pleased to offer this lovely 1998 BMW Z3 for your consideration. This Hellrot red car is in extraordinary condition inside and out. The exterior features straight panel and excellent shine on its paint. There are chrome 16in wheels with Hankook tires as well as a wind blocker and a very nice convertible top. The interior is in excellent shape and features nice black leather seats with red piping. The driver's seat has power function and the car also has power windows, power mirrors, stereo, air conditioning, twin airbags, cruise control, and a cassette player.

Wonderful inside and and out, this Z3 is an excellent driver with a tight shifter, accurate steering, and great brakes. It's seen just a few miles since it was new and is a total blast to wind out. You won't be disappointed with this classic BMW sports car! Comes with two keys and the owners manual.

We are happy to have acquired this American imported 1964 Austin Healy 3000 MK3 BJ8 in an authentic outstanding condition! This car has never needed to be anywhere near a restorer and is an exceptional original! The bodywork is awesome with nice and well-fitted body panels and lovely chrome details. The paintwork though original has remarkably well withstood the elements over the years. The original underbody is solid and perfectly intact. Finished in her original colour scheme of ‘Old English White (1st coat) with a super red leather trim. The interior has great patination. It would hard to find a car like this one anywhere in today's market. An absolute original top class and unadulterated example for any car-lover!
Price in euro's € 69.950,-

Gateway Classic Cars of Houston is proud to offer up this mean 1971 Pontiac GTO Judge tribute for sale. Between the retro styling and the powerful engine this car is extremely fun to drive.Under the hood of this beauty is a 455 CID V8 that has been hopped up with a rebuild and fuel injection. This sweet powertrain also includes MSD electronic ignition. This engine pulls much harder than one would expect. With a proper set of tires this car could even be a mean 1/4 mile racer. Sending the power to the rear end is a Muncie 22 four speed manual transmission that shifts correctly through the gears. Overall this powertrain is bad*** and really gets the car going!Upon entering the car the driver will be greeted by a clean black interior. This car does not have very many frills but it is equipped with heat for those colder drives. This sweet ride does also have power steering and power brakes. Overall the interior is in good condition with a few minor imperfections.Moving outward the exterior of the car is is finished in copper colored paint and fitted with Judge trim pieces. The paint and trim are in decent condition with some flaws on the front end. Supporting each corner of the car are rally wheels wrapped in radial tires with decent tread life left. Overall this car looks pretty good and drives even better!For more information on this 1971 Pontiac GTO located in our Houston showroom come by and see us or contact the showroom at (832)243-6220 or email the showroom at
[Email Dealer]

Beautiful Alfa Romeo Spider 2.0 on offer. Newly registered on the 28th September 1992, this car was exported to the Netherlands over 17 years ago. This is the type 4 version with a 120 PS (118BHP) powerful 2.0 engine ,was the last rear-wheel driven Spider produced. Finished in the original special colour ‘Giallo Ginestra' with gorgeous black half leather and alcantara trim and matching black soft-top. The interior is still fully original and is in excellent condition. The paintwork is in good condition with a nice lustre. This good as new car only has 53,818 km on the clock. Driving this Alfa is simply wonderful thanks to the flawless mechanics. It has Azev rims and other exhaust system. A top quality Alfa, ready for that perfect summers day! THIS VEHICLE IS IN OUR STORAGE, VIEWING BY APPOINTMENT ONLY.
Price in euro's € 23.500,-
1970 Ford Mustang Boss 302

This outstanding 1970 Boss 302 Mustang came to us from a real Ford guy that spent far more on this great Mach 1 than it is selling for today.  It comes with a binder full of receipts and original documentation including Warranty Card, very fresh engine rebuild with dyno sheet, and Marti Report not to mention photos of the rebuild process with all the specs.   It is powered by a numbers matching Boss 302 4V small block with 4 speed and is expertly finished in correct and original Calypso Coral with Black interior, wow!  The quality of the work and materials is superb on this restored to original Boss 302 Mustang.  This great Boss has had some awesome upgrades like the Track Pac with tranny cooler and traction lok differential, the carb is the Boss correct Holley, at a cost of over $4k on Ebay today, and all the smog stuff and Rev Limiter are there (how often do you see that?!) This one is one of only 2172 built with this Paint and Trim.  Hurry and you can enjoy this fine Pony Car today.
Features
Detailed engine bay with VIN stamped 302 V8 4V
Smooth Shifting wide ratio 4 speed transmission correct Shifter
Pedal Ease Power Disc Brakes</ li>
3.50 Ratio Standard Axle
Correct Steering Wheel
Performance Tuned Dual Exhaust with  a great note
This great Boss still has the smog control and rev limiter in place
Excellent Set of Matched BFG RWL Radial P225/60R15
Magnum 500 Wheels with Center Caps
Safety Guard Package with Seat Belts Padded Dash and Sun Visors
Visibility Group with Dual Color Keyed Outside Sport Mirrors
Optional Fiberglass Rear Deck Spoiler and Window Slats
Dyno print out shows peak Horse Power is 352 at 5400 RPM with 351 lbft of torque at 4600 RPM
AM Push Button Radio
Clean Solid Trunk with Space Saver Spare Tire, Jack and mat
120 MPH Speedometer
Finished in highly desirable Diamond Calypso Coral with Blackout hood, Code 1
Fabulous Black Clarion Knit Hi Back Bucket Seats Code BA
Here is your chance to own one of the finer restored Boss 302s in the country today
1964 Chevrolet Malibu SS

This is a real SS, 458 code car, with a 350  V8 with Pro Comp aluminum heads 600 CFM 4 Barrel Edelbrock on an Edelbrock Performer intake, correct PowerGlide Transmission, and 3.36 open 10 bolt rear end.  Breathing is aided by a full dual exhaust system that starts with full headers through Flow Master mufflers and out the tail end and that gives it a great note.  This SS was repainted about 10 years ago and it shines well even today, but there are some minor hickeys in the paint from over the years. Nothing drastic but they are there.  It is a solid panel vehicle that runs, sounds, and drives great. This great Malibu SS is an original California built car with factory AC that really works.  It is hard to find a true SS in this kind of shape and with these options for the money.  Don't miss out on this well cared for 54 year old classic muscle car.
Features
Strong running 350 V8 with 4 Barrel Carb and Edlebrock Intake
Smooth Shifting Power GlideTransmission with a 3.36 open 10 Bolt Gear
This one has the very rare and always desirable working factory AC
Factory correct steering wheel with Bowtie logo and padded dash
Newer 215-70R14 Goodyear Eagle RH Radial Tires
Chevy SS Chrome 5 Spoke Wheels really add to the look
Tight and Excellent Handling Front End
Very good carpets and headliner along with chrome and stainless trim pieces
Center Console with correct shifter
Immaculate Black Vinyl Bucket Seats with belts code 714
Finished in freshly buffed and waxed in correct Goldwood Yellow code 943
Driver's Outside Rear View Mirror
Performance Tuned Full Dual Exhaust
Factory Instrumentation with tachometer mounted to the steering column
Bow Tie logo AMFM with Cassette in the correct opening in the dash
Tinted Glass in all the Windows
Freshly Detailed Engine Bay and Trunk with Jack and Spare
120 MPH speedometer with only 94XXX miles on the odometer
There were only 67100 of the Malibus built and how many were SSs?

Gateway Classic Cars is pleased to offer this 1979 Pontiac Trans Am for sale in their Indianapolis showroom.  Condition condition condition!  This is a car you won"??t have to apologize for"?¦it"??s a stunner!  The outside sports a gleaming PPG starlight black paint that"??s accented with a bright red and gold firebird hood applique. But you"??ll find the most unique of all its features on the interior with the freshly restored pristine white vinyl seats.  Very few cars with this color combination were ever built.  This Trans Am has been lovingly cared for its entire life and one look will have you hooked. The numbers matching 6.6L V8 rumbles to life with the reliability of a new car and sends power through a smooth shifting automatic transmission.  A new flowmaster exhaust gives the Trans Am a serious note.  Custom snowflake wheels posi-trac rear axle tilt steering wheel power windows steering and brakes a new MP3 audio system and a freshly installed air conditioning system round out the features of this Trans Am.  Recent mechanical upgrades include; rear brakes front wheel bearings steering gear air filter tire alignment and valve cover gaskets.Be sure to visit our webpage at www.gatewayclassiccars.com to view 100+ HD pictures as well as a short video of the car in action.  Better yet stop by our Indianapolis showroom and see her in person.  We"??re located at 4400 West 96th Street Indianapolis In. 46268.  Call us directly at 317-688-1100 and we"??ll be happy to share additional information or schedule an appointment for you to experience this amazing car.

Our Detroit Showroom is proud to offer a very high quality 1941 Willys Coupe. This Willys custom hotrod is painted in House of Kolor Tangelo Pearl up top and Sunset Orange Pearl on the lower which is painted over a White base.  Flames were added for a unique look which were painted by the famous Boogieman. This Willys is powered by a professionally built Supercharged 454 CID V8.  This powerhouse is equipped with a Weiand 671 Blower dual Edelbrock Endurashine Carburetors  MSD ignition system for better spark Chrome waterpump alternator and AC compressor and a Be-Cool tri-Flow radiator. This powerplant is paired to a beefed up 3 Speed Automatic transmission which hands off power to the Ford 9"?Posi-Traction rear end with shortened Moser axle shafts and is translated to the pavement via the Hoosier radials.  The sticky rubbers are wrapped around chrome Budnik Custom wheels which look amazing and make the Pearl paint pop.  The custom leather Procar seats are wrapped in chamois and cashmere with 3-point retractable seat belts and Iditit tilt wheel allow you to enjoy this beast comfortably when open road cruising.  The interior provides some great modern pieces such as classic vintage gauges custom machined trim pieces Vintage Air Gen II Heat/AC/Defrost and Specialty Power Windows. This iconic beauty is sure to take home some awards and turn heads down the road. There is a full list of the custom work done to this Willys which is far too much to list so for more information on this gorgeous Willys please visit www.GatewayClassicCars.com or call to speak with one of our friendly and knowledgeable staff members at 313-982-3100.

A very special 1965 Zündapp Super Combinette Type 515-041. This example has benefitted from a total recent restoration in Germany that has been recorded from A to Z. No imitation or reproduction materials were used during the process at all! The chrome detailing is also completely original and brought back to new! Their amazing attention to detail even went as far as showing the spot welding on for instance the front mudguard, just like they were in 1965! Everything is so new that the engine still needs to be run in. This bike delivers a wonderful drive and the 3-speed foot transmission is easy to use. All in all a rather unique Zündapp that has been brought back to new with a correctly recorded history!
Price in euro's € 4.750,-
1974 BMW 2002 Turbo
Chassis No. 4290376
Engine No. 4290376
Italian Delivery Example, Delivered to Verona, Italy on May 3, 1974
Numbers-Matching Engine
Factory 5-Speed Manual Close Ratio Dog-Leg Gearbox
Rare Rear Window Defrost
Original Color Chamonix-White
BMW Historical Certificate No. 1034
Restored by 02 Specialist Casey Motorsports
Multiple Concours/BMW Meets Winner
Known Ownership History
One of 1672 Turbos Built, Never Sold to the USA
History

This turbo has benefited from careful ownership throughout its life. Sold new to a resident in Verona, Italy. The turbo received major services at a BMW/Ferrari dealership in Catania, Italy in 1988. It was then sold to Alaimo Gaetano of Enna, Sicily. The car remained in Alaimo's care and was reportedly in static storage until 2001 when it was sold to a US collector Clarence ''Chip'' E Steele of Beaufort, SC on February 19, 2001 the odometer read 81,000 KM's. Chip replaced the fuel tank with an OEM 70 liter unit and imported the car to the US when his tour ended in Naples.
On March 12, 2002 Christopher Provo of San Francisco, CA purchased the Turbo now with 84,222 KM's and a two-year long restoration was commissioned by renowned 02 specialist Casey Motorsports.
In 2008 it was sold to Michael Briones of Novato, CA on August 6, 2008
The last owner of record was BMW collector Jeff Kearl of San Clemente, CA who purchase the turbo from Michael on October 23, 2010.
Restoration

Casey Motorsports in Petaluma, CA was entrusted to perform a thorough restoration, with work performed emphasized on mechanicals. The engine and transmission were rebuilt, a new OEM turbo was installed, a new LSD was installed, new spoiler, new Alpina quick ratio steering box. Photos of the extensive work are included with the sale as well as on Casey Motorsports website. Parts totaled $29,527.54 not including labor! The interior is mostly original with the exception of the door panels which where replaced. And period correct BBS wheels were installed. Post restoration the car was shown at BMW events throughout California. Carl from La Jolla Independent serves as a vintage BMW technical director for BMW/CCA believes this is one of the finest 2002 Turbo's in existence.
Today

The turbo remains well kept mechanically excellent. Steering is tight, braking is firm, and the acceleration is very good and only gets better when the turbo kicks in. The underside of the car is exceptionally clean and the paint although no longer concours is of high quality. All lights, swtiches, gauges are working as they should.

02 Turbos have been admired by sportscar enthusiast for decades and have now captured the attention of serious collectors. To find such a high-quality example available stateside today is a rare occurrence. If you have been searching for the right 02 Turbo we strongly recommend serious attention to this example.
Compression Test Numbers – Performed 3/2/2018
1971 Porsche 911T 2.2L Coupé
Chassis No. 9111120389
Engine No. 6114397
Numbers Matching Engine
Restored in 1985 – Color Changed from Signal Orange to Black
Rebuilt Engine by Kelly Moss Motorsports (Over $17k Invested)
Air Conditioning Installed by Selling Dealer
Original Glass All Around
Proper Working Wipers, Lights, Signals, Radio w/ Antenna, Horn, & Gauges
Includes Original Owner's Manual, Service/Maintenance Booklet, Toolkit, Porsche Long-Term Previous Ownership with Exceptional Documentation
Certificate of Authenticity & Records Back to the Late 1970's!

This numbers matching 911T ''long hood'' benefits from long term previous ownership, recent major service and an engine rebuild by known Porsche specialist Kelly Moss Motorsports. The previous owners were knowledgeable Porsche collectors who properly cared for and maintained the mechanicals.

The history and service files are extensive and includes letters, receipts, manuals and previous registrations. The paint is over 30 years old and exhibits minor flaws but presents nicely as a ''driver''. The interior is nicely detailed with a newer dash pad firm seats and nice carpeting accented with black coco mats. The underside has been steam cleaned as has the engine compartment and both present nicely. If you have been looking for a fairly priced early long hood 911 to have as a turn-key driver or event car we strongly recommend this example. Please contact our sales specialist for additional information.

Ok, before everyone gets up in arms about the things missing making it a Tuxedo Park, let me just start by saying we know.  It is in fact a true Tuxedo Park CJ6A with correct VIN and title, we do know that obviously the chrome bumpers have been replaced, there is no drop down license plate holder and the column shift has been replaced with a floor shift manual.  This Tuxedo Park comes out of the SouthWest and is very clean.  The engine is the original V6.  Now that being said from what we can find, is that only approximately 460 CJ6 models were ever produced, so  just having our hands on one is pretty impressive.  The VIN indicates this as it starts with a prefix of 8422.  This CJ6A starts on a dime and goes down the road as you would suspect.  It has plenty of power and garners attention everywhere you go.  It does not appear to leak or smoke and is very reliable.  The body looks as though it has been restored but has been done nicely.  There are seat belts in the jeep but the rest is what you see is what you get.  Own a piece of Jeep history and buy this rare piece.  Drive it as is or restore it to its classic original glory.
To see over 80 photos of this car, including undercarriage please visit our website www.grautogallery.com

Now five generations of F-series trucks had been built, this generation was built from 1966 through 1972. It was built on the same platform as the fourth generation, however was built with sharper styling lines, larger cab and more engine options. Also available were three trim levels changing names mid way through production. This particular F100 has come directly out of Arizona and is extremely clean for a largely original truck. This ''Custom Cab'' is equipped with the highly sought after 390 cubic Inch engine option that produces more than 250 HP. Another great advantage is this truck has working and COLD air conditioning. This truck starts at the snap of the key and is propelled down the road by the very strong engine. This truck was originally equipped with a manual transmission but was converted at some point to a automatic. I would not hesitate to drive this non-leaking, non-smoking really cool truck anywhere. The body on this truck is not free from imperfections but like I said before is very clean for the year.
To see over 80 photos of this car, including undercarriage please visit our website www.grautogallery.com

GR Auto Gallery is pleased to present this one owner 2007 Chevrolet Corvette Convertible for consideration. This Corvette is in excellent condition and looks stunning in Monterey Red. The convertible top when down is hidden beneath the matching paint hard tonneau covers. It's powered by the original 6.0L V8 400 horsepower engine and the very entertaining 6 speed automatic transmission. This Vette has always been meticulously maintained and only driven in nice conditions. You do not want to miss this one, please call or email us today for more information.

The Chevrolet Corvette, known colloquially as the Vette or Chevy Corvette, is a sports car manufactured by Chevrolet. The car has been produced through seven generations. The C6 generation of Corvettes brought about all new bodywork, exposed headlamps for the first time since 1962, an overhaul of the suspension geometry, a larger passenger cabin, a larger engine, and a much higher level of refinement. The classic handling ability of the Corvettes was again improved and then combined with a 400 horsepower V8.

GR Auto Gallery is pleased to present this one owner 2006 Dodge Daytona Charger R/T for consideration. It's powered by the original 5.7 Liter V8 engine paired with the automatic transmission. This one owner beauty has some upgrades which include; AirHammer intake, JBA header and Hi-flow cats, Borla 125 exhaust, SAMCO orange hoses, 6k HID fog lights, block heater, Daytona floor mats, newer hood shocks, RER Navigation Bluetooth radio, painted calipers, leather center console, SRT8 hood/fascia, F1 ceramic 35% tint, back-up camera, OEM remote starter and more. Please call or email us today for more information on this 2006 Dodge Daytona Charger R/T.

Dodge reintroduced their claim to fame Charger in glorious fashion in 2006 and all gearheads and Mopar junkies finally had a car to get excited about for its looks and performance. The price range was well thought after to allow people to get into one without the outrageous price tag of other performance vehicles such as the Viper. Dodge also did a great job keeping looks and styles from the earlier generations and available performance upgrades that were plentiful on the aftermarket circuit.
